item.title: I accidentally killed it (and evaporated $300 million)
item.description: Github user devops199 said on Twitter “I accidentally killed it”. Before anyone can blink an eye, his “accident” has “killed” Ethereum accounts holding over $300M in crypto assets. On average, each of his 4 words cost $75M. One of those Ethereum accounts belongs to the Polkadot project, and it held close to $90M before it was “killed”. Someone asked devops199 after the incident: Why did you do it? His response?
